STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
April 2, 2024
Jolyne Baarck
FAMILY YOUTH INTERVENTIONS
418 CASS AVE,
MOUNT CLEMENS, MI, 48043-2123
Re: License #: CI500201123
Dear Jolyne Baarck:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on 3/8/24 . Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action
plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and
must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the
corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (517) 243-9743.
Sincerely,
Venus M. Decker,
Child Welfare Licensing Consultant
enclosure

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the
following:

CCI Rule 400.4166 Discharge plan
• (1) When a resident is discharged from
institutional care, all of the following
information shall be documented in the case
record within 14 days after discharge:
• (e) A statement that the discharge plan
recommendations, including medical
and dental follow up that is needed,
have been reviewed with the resident
and with the parent and with the
responsible case manager.
Two out of two closed files were reviewed. Two out of two files did not have a
statement regarding the discharge plan recommendations were shared with the
parent or worker.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
Technical assistance was not requested or required.
V. CONSULTATION
The agency was offered consultation in the following areas:
• CCI Rule 400.4166 was discussed with the agency. Ideas were offered to help
create a document that meets all licensing rule requirements.
• Consutlation was provided to have new Program Managers contact the
consultant so introductions can be made and roles can be described.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has not been required to submit any corrective action plans during this
period under review.

Financial Overview
I have reviewed the annual financial audit and report. The agency does not have
any financial concerns or issues.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
N/A
Chief Administrator Assessment
The grievance policy has been updated and staff have been trained on the new
policy. This policy has been placed in the new student and parent handbook. The
agency has had unplanned discharges. These discharges are due to improper
placements, youth needing a higher level of care available, and those who self-
terminated by leaving the program. The agency will continue to monitor the
licensing rules and maintain them.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Due to mold issues, the agency has not been in operation since the first week of
February 2024 and therefore, have no youth in their program. The Program
Manager reported the mold has been resolved. They are currently fixing the
drywall in the basement area. Once this is completed, they will be able to operate
again.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The home is clean and has an inviting atmosphere. The home is currently under
small renovations due to the mold issue from early February 2024. The basement
has been emptied due to the renovations.

VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is
recommended that the agency will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
3/26/24
___________________________________
Venus M. Decker Date
Child Welfare Licensing Consultant
